h1.span: Franklin County Technical School Receives nearly $6,500 to Expand Healthy Meal Service to Children During School Closures

div.p: We are proud to ensure meals available daily to every child, 0-21, during school closures. A breakfast and a lunch are available every day M-F thanks to our partnership with Kuzmeskus Bus Company. See meal locations and times here. We hope you’ll start coming and spread the word.

span.span:
Franklin County Technical School Receives nearly $6,500 to Expand
Healthy Meal Service to Children During School Closures

i.span: Nutritious Breakfast and Lunch available free for all children ages 0-21

span.span: April 13, 2020 — To support families during school closures, Franklin County Technical School (FCTS) is providing children aged 0-21 with free, nutritious breakfast and lunch meals every day of the week as part of the USDA’s emergency COVID-19 response. The Eos Foundation awarded the district a $6,466 grant to support continued distribution of meals to children.

“We want everyone to know that these healthy meals are available to every child, 0-21. You don’t have to be a FCTS student to receive them. In fact, parents/caregivers can pick up meals on children’s behalf to help ensure safe social distancing,” said Superintendent Richard Martin. “We know that home food supplies are running low and it’s important to try to keep people out of the supermarkets. This is a federally funded program, and the food is nutritious, so please come take your meals!”

ul.style: color:#222222; font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size:small; font-style:normal; font-variant-ligatures:normal; font-variant-caps:normal; font-weight:400; letter-spacing:normal; orphans:2; text-align:start; text-transform:none; white-space:normal; widows:2; word-spacing:0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width:0px; background-color:#ffffff; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial; margin-top:0in

span.span: Children receive 2 free meals/day (bagged breakfast and bagged lunch). Children (or parents/guardians on behalf of children) can take both meals at once.
Children do not need to be present for parents/guardians to pick up the meals.
Meals are available to all children ages 0-21, including preschool-aged children.
All children are welcome regardless of town of residence or school attended, this is a community-wide meals program.
All sites encourage safe social distancing and ask that individuals remain six feet apart.
Anyone who cannot make it out of their house to pick up a meal is encouraged to c

“I am inspired by the unbelievable dedication and work our cafeteria workers are doing each and every day to prep and help serve more than 800 meals,” continued Martin. “They put themselves on the front lines to help our community. I am totally amazed and blessed to be part of a team of cafeteria workers which truly express the qualities hope, generosity, and love.”

“We are proud to help support the great work of Liz Bouchard, the FCTS Nutrition Director, and her team,” said Andrea Silbert, President of the Eos Foundation. “They are front-lines heroes at this unprecedented time.”

FCTS delivers meals in collaboration with Kuzmeskus Bus Company. “I cannot express enough gratitude towards each and every driver at Kuzemskus,” said Liz Bouchard. “They all choose to make this happen for our community each day and take such personal ownership of each route. We would struggle so much without them.
Meals are delivered M-F via seven routes according to the following schedule:
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Turners Falls Sheffield Elementary School: (10:45 AM)
Hillcrest Homes Central Parking Lot: (10:50 AM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Executive Inn Orange, off Rt.2: (11:05 AM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
Corner of North Cross Rd & Main Rd: (12:20 PM)
Pick up at Franklin County Tech: (10:35 AM)
PVRS in the parking lot (11:30 AM)
Corner of Rt. 142 & Gerrish Rd. (11:40 AM)

p.em:
Posted: to FCTS Special News Alerts on Mon, Apr 13, 2020
Updated: Thu, Apr 16, 2020
